issue.title: www.thedailybeast.com
issue.body:

issue.title: www.pinterest.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.pinterest.com/search/pins/?q=guts&rs=typed](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pinterest.com%2Fsearch%2Fpins%2F%3Fq%3Dguts%26rs%3Dtyped) ### Comment > Pinterest has disabled the ability to hit "enter" when typing a search when adguard or any ad-blocking extension is enabled. > > 1. Ensure adguard enabled > 2. Type a search term in the search bar (must be logged in) > 3. Hit enter > 4. The page will not return any search > > Pinterest has recently sent pop-ups telling users to disable adblockers and this is the punishment. Also, they kind of suck right now. > > Thank you guys in advance. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/bnnomdgmzhsso00kcw80go8kc0sk0sdqo86xs5gbkg.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/20pa5w4odf6s0cckcckgs0wok0k4k0wreqwzzvu7rk.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.81 MV3 System version: | Windows 11 Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Other:
Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Other extensions used: | Ghostery (disabled) - still does not work
